revised_title: Chromosome Constitution and Behavior in Pomoideae
tldr: The author investigates the chromosome constitution of the pomoideae, a group of plants that includes apples, pears, and other fruit trees. They find that all species and varieties in the group have a basic chromosome number of 17 and are orthoploid, meaning they have 34, 51, or 68 chromosomes. The author also observes a high degree of similarity in chromosome behavior during meiosis, with some abnormalities and secondary pairing occurring. Triploid and tetraploid forms were found to be auto-polyploids, meaning they arise from the functioning of an unreduced gamete in a normal diploid.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Plant Biology
